definition: office/situation/classifier for games: match, set, round etc

sentences.english: Suddenly the phone rang, the gamble was forced to terminate. < /p> < p> Tianlong.
sentences.chinese: 突然一通電話響起，令賭局被迫終止。

sentences.english: A calculated gamble, or another century of failure?
sentences.chinese: 精心準備的賭局，還是又一個百年失敗？

sentences.english: The speculative bubble was based on a bet that served as its own foundation.
sentences.chinese: 投機的泡沫建立在賭局之上，以此作爲其自身的基礎。

sentences.english: A one-sided gamble of inquiry, the beginner blade doubt to wantonly westerlo.
sentences.chinese: 一邊倒的賭局中，新手刀鋒毫無懸念地大肆敗北。

sentences.english: Counting on Chinese consumers, however, may not be a sure bet.
sentences.chinese: 然而，寄希望於國內消費者也許是個勝算難說的賭局。

sentences.english: Most open gambling and people will cheat in gambling.
sentences.chinese: 大部分開賭局和的人都會在賭具上作弊。

definition: to shift one's eyes/(fig.) to shift one's attention/to divert attention
stake (in a gamble)/(what is at) stake
variant of 巨額|巨额[ju4 e2]
public courtroom accusation (idiom)/legal confrontation/to take sb to court/to sue
(of a pendulum) to stop swinging/(of work, production, activities etc) to come to a halt/to be suspended/to be canceled/shutdown/(sports) lockout
to procrastinate/to stall for time/to filibuster
to count and check/to tally/points (collected in some bonus scheme etc)
